intro: Petalidium glandulosum, commonly known as the sticky leaf orchid, is a small, flowering plant native to the humid forests of South America. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its unique, often fragrant flowers. The plant has hairy or glandular leaves, which give it its scientific name, and it typically grows in shaded, moist environments. It produces small, delicate flowers that are usually greenish or yellowish in color. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
